newsitem.title: DENMARK: SOCCER-RELENTLESS DANES SCORE 4-0 WIN OVER SLOVENIA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RELENTLESS DANES SCORE 4-0 WIN OVER SLOVENIA.

text.p: Denmark overcame the loss through injury of captain Michael Laudrup to beat Slovenia 4-0 in their World Cup European group one qualifier on Wednesday.
Living up to pre-match promises to take control from the start, the Danes went straight on the offensive and midfielder Allan Nielsen scored the first after just four minutes.
Striker Per Pedersen put the Danes 2-0 up in the 28th minute when he sped through the Slovenian defence to receive a cross from Jan Heintze and power it into the net.
The Danes kept up the pressure in the second half, coming close several times before Brian Laudrup scored his team's third goal after a failed attempt by Nielsen in the 52nd minute.
Nielsen grabbed his second four minutes later to make it 4-0 and leave Denmark nicely placed on 10 points with three wins and a draw.
